title: Here Are The Bands Requiring Fans To Provide Proof Of Vaccination Or A Negative Covid Test To Attend Their Shows
author: Tommy Beer
description: The Eagles, Maroon 5 and The Killers are just a few of the many bands demanding enhanced health protocols.
cleaned_text: that they will require proof of full vaccination against Covid-19 or a recent negative test as a prerequisite to attend their shows, joining a growing list of U.S.-based bands, solo artists and concert venues implementing enhanced restrictions amid a nationwide spike in coronavirus infections and hospitalizations attributed to the delta variant. Key Facts Last month, before the start of their summer tour, Phish [issued a statement](https://phish.com/news/summer-tour-begins-tonight-please-read/) urging fans to get their shots, stating the "best thing you can possibly do before coming to a show is to GET VACCINATED!" Yet after two weeks of concerts crisscrossing seven states, the band has decided to do more than simply make a request and institute the new rule instead. [Maroon 5](https://twitter.com/maroon5/status/1425554119276699651/photo/2) announced Wednesday that they would require proof of vaccination or a negative Covid-19 test to attend their shows, beginning next week. [Dead & Co](https://deadandcompany.com/)., featuring John Mayer, is enforcing similar protocols during their nationwide tour this summer, explaining, "Requiring vaccinations & testing is one of the best ways to protect the health and safety of our band, crew and fans. There are no exceptions to these policies." [The Killers](https://www.newsobserver.com/entertainment/article253422494.html) are also requiring ticket holders to provide proof of vaccination or a negative diagnostic test within 48 hours prior to entry. Jason Isbell [said](https://www.forbes.com/sites/tommybeer/2021/08/09/musician-jason-isbell-ill-only-perform-for-audiences-that-are-vaccinated-or-show-a-negative-covid-test/?sh=26fe4b572c97) Monday that he and his band, the 400 Unit, will require concertgoers to provide proof of vaccination or a negative test to attend all their future shows, whether they are held indoors or outdoors, and that everyone in attendance would also be required to wear a mask. The Foo Fighters, which held a concert for [only fully vaccinated attendees](https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/21/arts/music/foo-fighters-madison-square-garden.html) in New York City in June, will require proof of vaccination or a negative test result for admission to [upcoming shows](https://www.wtnh.com/news/connecticut/fairfield/foo-fighters-set-to-perform-in-bridgeport-will-require-proof-of-covid-19-vaccination-or-negative-test/). [Bonnaroo](https://www.npr.org/2021/08/10/1026489397/bonnaroo-requires-vaccination-covid-test), a four-day event in Tennessee, [Summerfest 2021](https://www.jsonline.com/story/entertainment/festivals/summerfest/2021/08/10/summerfest-require-proof-vaccination-negative-covid-19-test/5550372001/) in Milwaukee and the Aftershock show, set to take place in Sacramento, California, in October, are among the many music festivals making proof of vaccination or a negative test result a prerequisite to attending. Crucial Quote: "We want you to know that our top priority is the safety and well-being of our fans as well as that of the hard-working men and women who make these events possible," [Maroon 5 tweeted](https://twitter.com/maroon5/status/1425554119276699651?s=20). "To that end, we want to convey our support of recent news around shows starting to require additional protocols for entry." Key Background: The United States is averaging more than [124,000](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/us/covid-cases.html) new coronavirus cases a day, the highest daily average in the country since the first week of February. Several states, including Florida and Louisiana, are reporting [record-highs](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/us/covid-cases.html). Many [health experts](https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/09/health/coronavirus-children-delta.html) have attributed the spiking surge to the spread of the dangerous delta variant and the country's lagging vaccination rates. Beginning in early October, [Live Nation's](https://www.forbes.com/sites/kimberleespeakman/2021/08/06/live-nation-concerts-may-require-attendees-be-vaccinated-for-covid-19/?sh=50b930c44d4c) fully owned and operated venues and festivals in the United States will be requiring all artists and fans to either show proof of vaccination or a negative Covid-19 test, where permitted by law. The company's employees will also need to be fully vaccinated in order to work at or visit one of their events, venues, or offices. "Vaccines are going to be your ticket back to shows, and as of October 4th we will be following the model we developed for Lollapalooza and requiring this for artists, fans and employees at Live Nation venues and festivals everywhere possible in the U.S.," said Michael Rapino, CEO of Live Nation Entertainment, in a statement. Tangent: Sean Agnew, co-owner of Union Transfer, a large concert venue in Pennsylvania that just reopened last week, [told](https://www.phillymag.com/news/2021/08/11/proof-of-vaccination-at-concerts/) Philadelphia Magazine that some artists have said they won't accept test results as an alternative to vaccination. "They only want to play to an entirely vaccinated crowd," Agnew says. On Monday, legendary rock band the [Eagles announced](https://ultimateclassicrock.com/eagles-vaccinated-concert/) a new concert on November 5 in Seattle, which will admit only fully vaccinated attendees. Big Number: 35. The [Kansas City Health Department](https://apnews.com/article/entertainment-music-health-arts-and-entertainment-coronavirus-pandemic-83dd951f76d95c1093b601a49eeab0db) set up a mobile vaccination clinic at Garth Brooks' concert in Kansas City on Saturday, and fans were offered a chance to get upgraded floor seats to the concert if they were vaccinated, but only 35 of the more than 70,000 people who attended took advantage of the offer.
